result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon W. Wals

defendant.name: Wals, Brandon W.
defendant.address: W5280 Aspen Avenue, Wild Rose, WI 54984

records.addlTxt: from the Court - DE's request for extension of the report date to jail is denied
Letter to Court requesting later report date - Denied by Court

Cases 22CF81 & 22CF59 called @ 3:12 PM: Defendant Brandon W. Wals in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for Brandon W. Wals. 22CF82 - Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Atty Blankschein advises that the parties have reached an agreement and are prepared to proceed to P/S today. 22CF59 - The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - reading waived. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 22CF59: Cts 1 & 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  22CF59: Ct 3 - DRI. 22CF81 - DRI. Statement by DE. Court orders: Ct 1 only - S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, DE must maintain absolute sobriety, DE may not be present upon the premises of any bars, DE is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Defendant is prohibited from having contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless they are in the immediate presence of a parent or guardian, Defendant is prohibited from engaging in any activity relating to social media, Defendant to obtain an HSED or GED, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. The Court orders forfeiture and destruction of the seized .22 Caliber semi automatic pistol.  Ct 2 only - 6 mos WC Jail - Huber, GT, 40 days CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than April 25, 2022. Appeal rights given. Defendant to report to DOC by no later than close of business on 4/12/2022.
Application for Search Warrant, Search Warrant, Return of Search Warrant - Residence at 626 Cleveland Avenue, Village of Wild Rose

Defendant is prohibited from being in possession of any device capable of accessing the internet. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with any children under the age of 18 years.

Case called @ 1:11 PM Defendant Brandon W. Wals in custody, appears via video with Attorney Emma K Blankschein for Brandon W. Wals appeared by video. Attorney Wesley Kottke for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant eligible for SPD services. Bond argument by ADA Kottke. Bond argument by Atty Blankschein. Court orders $10,000 Cash Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
